text:
- We are responsible for
the official Bundesliga app,

and it's an application
that every fan can use
to get informed about matches, players,

and everything around what's
happening in the Bundesliga.

And one of the most demanded
features in our fan service

was the request for a
notification preference center,

so Amazon Pinpoint helped
us to implement this
to give our fans most control

about the notifications
they want to receive.
We see that Pinpoint and the approach
from coming from a raw messaging approach

to an engagement and
marketing approach gives us
a lot of flexibility.

What we then have is the
opportunity to build segments

once we identify interest
in certain things,

so for example, we
collect fan behavior data.

And we also see that all these
efforts in personalization
of the notification preference center

not only helps our fans, but
also, helps us to reduce costs.
I think we make a transition right now
from thinking more about engagements

and thinking more about not
using Pinpoint, Amazon Pinpoint,

just for sending messages, but
maybe, for building journeys,

engagement journeys, to drive
signup conversions for this

to really help to support
our company objectives

in becoming the most
digital league in the world.
(upbeat music)
